item.title: Quantitative Analyst at Flutter
item.description: After almost 2 wonderful years working in Met Éireann, I decided to move to a new role as Quantitative Analyst at Flutter UKI .

item.title: Meteorologist at Met Éireann
item.description: In October 2022, I was promoted at Met Éireann to the role of Machine Learning Meteorologist.

item.title: A coupled electrochemomechanical model for the cycling of a Cu15Si4-hosted silicon nanowire
item.description: My latest work has been published in the Journal of power sources.

item.title: Postdoctoral researcher at Met Éireann
item.description: In October 2021, I begun a new research position at Met Éireann .

item.title: A validated asymptotic thermomechanical model for air-gap formation in tapered moulds in the continuous casting of steel
item.description: My latest work has been published in the IMA Journal of Applied Mathematics.

item.title: Postdoctoral researcher Si-Drive, UL
item.description: In 2020, I begun a postdoctoral research role in MACSI, Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of LimerickL, researching nanowire technology in lithium ion battery anodes as part of the Si-Drive consortium.

item.title: Analysis of a model for the formation of fold-type oscillation marks in the continuous casting of steel
item.description: My latest work has been published in the IMA Journal of Applied Mathematics.

item.title: PhD Graduation
item.description: In February 2020, I completed my PhD thesis. My PhD study was on mathematical modelling of continuous steel casting.

item.title: On the formation of fold-type oscillation marks in the continuous casting of steel
item.description: My latest work has been published in Royal Society Open Science.
